intro: Gomphrena decumbens f. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf gomphrena, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and vibrant, long-lasting blooms. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. Its flowers are usually pink or red, forming dense, spherical clusters that attract pollinators. Gomphrena decumbens f. lanceolata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
